meanings.definition: to move or go with short, quick steps
meanings.sent1: The little girl totted happily to the playground.
meanings.sent2: The puppy totted around the yard, exploring everything.
meanings.sent3: The duck totted behind the farmer, hoping for some breadcrumbs.
meanings.sent4: The leaves totted down the street in the wind like tiny dancers.
meanings.sent5: The toddler totted carefully across the room, holding onto the furniture.

meanings.sent1: She totted the numbers in her head to find the sum.
meanings.sent2: The cashier totted the prices of the groceries at the checkout.
meanings.sent3: The students totted their scores to see who won the game.
meanings.sent4: The hours totted up quickly as they worked on the project.
meanings.sent5: He totted the coins in his pocket to see if he had enough for ice cream.

meanings.sent1: The loyal dog totted beside his owner on the walk.
meanings.sent2: She totted along with her friend to the store.
meanings.sent3: The cat totted after the family, wanting attention.
meanings.sent4: The shadow totted behind him in the dimly lit alley.
meanings.sent5: The little sister totted after her big brother wherever he went.
